paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common mutation worldwide, which is associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP), is the Val30Met variant found in patients of Portuguese, Swedish and Japanese decent.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is known to cause systemic amyloidosis, mainly impacting the peripheral nervous system and the heart.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical association.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is one of the most studied in relation to hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most common mutation worldwide, which is associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP), is the Val30Met variant found in patients of Portuguese, Swedish and Japanese decent.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common mutation in the USA, the Val122Ile variant, is associated with ATTR cardiomyopathy and is carried by 3–4% of the African American population with variable penetrance.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant is associated with increased risk of developing ATTR cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical association.
key_quotes: The most common mutation in the USA, the Val122Ile variant, is associated with ATTR cardiomyopathy and is carried by 3–4% of the African American population with variable penetrance.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
